alert.note: Alert for Campbell; Kenton (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 18 at 1:44PM EST by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...SNOW SHOWERS WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF NORTHERN KENTON...CAMPBELL... EASTERN HAMILTON...CLERMONT...NORTHWESTERN BROWN...SOUTHERN WARREN... SOUTHWESTERN FAYETTE...CLINTON...SOUTH CENTRAL GREENE AND NORTHWESTERN HIGHLAND COUNTIES THROUGH 215 PM EST... At 144 PM EST, snow showers were located along a line extending from 8 miles south of Xenia to Lakeside Park, moving southeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 45 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Rapid reductions in visibility may cause travel difficulties. In addition, bridges and overpasses may become briefly snow covered and slick. Locations impacted include... Cincinnati, Covington, Mason, Independence, Lebanon, Norwood, Erlanger, Fort Thomas, Newport, Sharonville, Wilmington, Blue Ash, Loveland, Reading, Montgomery, Madeira, Edgewood, Alexandria, Elsmere, and Fort Mitchell. This includes the following Interstates... I-71 in Ohio between mile markers 0 and 25, and between mile markers 28 and 57. I-75 in Kentucky between mile markers 185 and 191. I-75 in Ohio between mile markers 0 and 4, and between mile markers 6 and 8. Exercise extra caution while traveling. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
